title: Miley Cyrus slammed for insisting queer women 'gave up on d**k'

Miley Cyrus has caused uproar after telling her Instagram fans that they "don't have to be gay" because "there are good men out there".

In a joint live video with new boyfriend Cody Simpson, the Wrecking Ball songstress left a lot of people upset with her comments and was slammed for "insulting" gay and bisexual women.

Miley, 26, told the audience: "Don't give up. You don't have to be gay, there are good people with d**ks out there, you just gotta find them.

"You just gotta find a d**k that's not a d**k, you know what I mean?"

While Cody laughed in the background, she added, "I always thought I had to be gay, because I just thought all guys are evil, but that's not true," no doubt a dig at her ex, Liam Hemsworth.

(Image: Instagram)

Fans of the former Disney Channel star took to Twitter and criticised her for the comment.

One frustrated fan wrote: "Miley, this is so not it. Women don't 'have to be gay' because they 'can#t find a good person with a d*ck'.

"Don't use the queer community as a stop-gap because you couldn't find a boyfriend.

(Image: Instagram)

"People aren't queer because they 'gave up' on men. This is so insulting."

Another penned: "From all the people in the world who could say this, miley is one of the last ones I could've thought of to try and invalidate queer women."

Miley has always been open about her sexuality, but the controversial comment comes after she spoke about the importance of her identity as a queer woman while in a heterosexual relationship with Liam.

(Image: Instagram)

At the time, Miley was two months into her marriage with estranged actor husband Liam, 29.

She told Vanity Fair: "A big part of my pride and my identity is being a queer person.

"What I preach is: People fall in love with people, not gender, not looks, not whatever."

After Miley and Liam split, she was seen kissing Kaitlynn Carter by a pool in Lake Como and it wasn't long before the pair got together in September.

(Image: Suzy Creamcheese / SplashNews.com)

The couple were spotted out in Los Angeles shortly after wearing near identical looks.

At some moments during their walk Kaitlynn tenderly placed a hand on Miley's stomach, while they had an animated conversation.

But just a few weeks after they were seen together, the girls called an end to their relationship.

A source said: "They're still friends.

"They've been friends forever and were there for each other when they were both getting separated.

"But they're just not in a romantic relationship anymore."
description: The popstar has upset gay and bisexual women by suggesting that they are queer because they 'gave up' on men
